\usepackage{sidecap}
\usepackage{verbatim}
\usepackage{mathrsfs}
\usepackage{refcount}
\usepackage{xparse}
\usepackage{mathabx}


 
\sidecaptionvpos{figure}{c}




\usepackage[margin=10pt,font=small,labelfont=bf,labelsep=endash,figurewithin=section,tablewithin=section]{caption}
% Caption figures and tables nicely. %% After cleveref.


% Number equations down to the subection level, e.g. 1.2.3 is the third equation in
% subsection 2 of section 1.
\numberwithin{equation}{section}
\newcommand*\tageq{\refstepcounter{equation}\tag{\theequation}}



\keepXColumns % Keeps the X column
\newcommand{\firstrowspacing}{\rule{0pt}{2.6ex}}



\theoremstyle{definition}
\newtheorem{definition}{Definition}[section]
\newtheorem*{remark}{Remark}
\newtheorem{conjecture}{Conjecture}

\newtheorem{theorem}{Theorem}
\newtheorem{assumption}{Assumption}




\newlist{steps}{enumerate}{1}
\setlist[steps, 1]{label = Step \arabic*:}



\newcolumntype{L}{>{$}l<{$}} % math-mode version of "l" column type


\bibliographystyle{unsrtnat}
\renewcommand{\bibname}



%\renewcommand{\submittedtext}{A technical report for} %comment this out if you don't want to change the writing
\project{InFoMM CDT Mini-Project 2}     %the degree
\projectdate{Trinity 2017}         %the degree date
\company{Tesco}
\supervisors{Raphael Hauser, George Dikas}%Include industrial and academic supervisors

%\makeatother


\newcounter{optproblemline}
\renewcommand{\theoptproblemline}{\alph{optproblemline}}
\makeatletter
\renewcommand{\p@optproblemline}{\theequation}
\makeatother

\ExplSyntaxOn
\NewDocumentCommand{\constraintset}{ m m }
{
	\shaul_opt_problem:n { #2 }
	\setcounter{optproblemline}{0}%
	\left\{ #1 \left \vert 
	\cs_set_eq:Nc \label { ltx@label } % in a group, reset \label
	\begin{array}{
			@{}
			l
			@{\quad}
			>{\refstepcounter{optproblemline}}l
			>{\textnormal{(\theoptproblemline)}}l
		}
		\tl_use:N \l_shaul_constraints_tl
	\end{array}
	\right.\right\rbrace
}

\tl_new:N \l_shaul_constraints_tl
\seq_new:N \l_shaul_constraints_seq

\cs_new_protected:Npn \shaul_opt_problem:n #1
{
	\tl_clear:N \l_shaul_constraints_tl
	\seq_set_split:Nnn \l_shaul_constraints_seq { ; } { #1 }
	\seq_map_inline:Nn \l_shaul_constraints_seq
	{
		\tl_put_right:Nn \l_shaul_constraints_tl { & ##1 & \\ }
	}
}
\ExplSyntaxOff


\title{Robust Vehicle Routing}


\author{Jonathan Peters}



\begin{document}
	\maketitle 
	\pagebreak
	
	\tableofcontents
	
	\include{main_body}
	
	\footnotesize
	\bibliography{references}
	
\end{document}
